How it Started
How it Started
We are proud to introduce a unique and inclusive gaming experience developed in collaboration with the esteemed Centro de Inclusão Social da Madeira (CISM). CISM is dedicated to promoting and developing comprehensive support actions aimed at ensuring the functional and holistic development of individuals with disabilities. Following this line of thought the board game was aimed to reflect the values of CISM, aiming to create an engaging and learning environment for people in the center with certain disabilities.
Research
Research
In line with our commitment to inclusivity and empowerment, we are thrilled to highlight the Café Inclusão project, a key initiative within the Centro de Inclusão Social da Madeira (CISM). This inspiring project aims to promote autonomy and integration into the workforce for individuals with disabilities. The Board game was designed with this mission in mind. We aspire to create engaging and educational experiences that not only entertain but also equip players with skills and confidence, enabling individuals to develop the competencies needed to thrive in the workforce and, ultimately, contribute to projects like Café Inclusão.
Brainstorming and Debating ideas
Brainstorming and Debating ideas
We engaged in dynamic brainstorming sessions to generate and refine ideas for our board and digital games. We considered various gameplay mechanics, educational objectives, and design elements that could best serve our mission. This collaborative process involved extensive debate and discussion, allowing us to weigh the pros and cons of different concepts and arrive at a cohesive vision for our games.
1st Prototype
1st Prototype
These initial versions included basic gameplay elements and preliminary designs, aimed at testing the core mechanics of the game. We conducted playtests between ourselves observing our interactions with the game and gathering feedback from experiences. This playtesting phase provided critical insights into the functionality and educational value of our prototypes, highlighting areas for improvement.
2nd Prototype
2nd Prototype
Based on feedback from the first playtest, we refined our prototypes to address identified issues and enhance the overall gameplay experience. The second prototype incorporated more polished designs, additional challenges, and improved educational resources. We conducted rounds of playtesting, involving our target audience to validate the enhancements and ensure the games were meeting our intended goals. The feedback from these playtests were instrumental in finalizing the key elements of the games.
Final Version
Final Version
After several playtests and refinements, we developed the complete versions of Give n' Take board game, incorporating all the adjustments and feedback from the previous playtests. The final versions featured fully realized designs, comprehensive educational content, and user-friendly assets. We conducted a last playtest with our target audience to ensure the game was engaging, accessible, and effective in teaching money management skills while being fun. This final round of testing confirmed the games' readiness for operation, marking the culmination of our development process.
